Pete,
Kibata-mei means signed on the edge/side.  It's seen fairly often in menuki and sometimes in kozuka.  I can't say that I've seen it done on a tsuba.

Jim  



  Would someone please explain what 'kibata' and 'kibata mei' are in 
  relation to menuki?  Thanks much!
